title: Armchair, ""Cockfight chair"", ca. 1720–30
dimensions:
H x W x D (Book rest and parts not extended): 92.2 x 77.5 x 72 cm (36 5/16 x 30 1/2 x 28 3/8 in.)
Open (chair with book rest, candlestick and tray in arm extended): 106 x 95 x 96 cm (41 3/4 x 37 3/8 x 37 13/16 in.)
description:
Form with square tapering seat and tall narrow back upholstered in dark brown nailed leather; back with horizontal U-curved arms at top fitted with hinged, adjustable wooden book rest on back; retractable tin candleholder in left arm, small retractable sectioned tray in right arm; drawer in seat; cabriole front legs with pad feet, turned stretchers, rear feet square in section; small brass caster on each foot.

A) chair
B) drawer
C) bookrest support

exhibitions.title: IDEO Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Armchair, ""Cockfight chair"", ca. 1720–30.
ca. 1720–30. Walnut, leather, brass, tin. Gift of Mrs. Paul Moore. 1960-164-16-a/c.
